title: China donates anti-epidemic supplies to Guinea-Bissau in April 2020
description: On April 18, 2020, protective and preventative equipment amidst COVID arrived in Guinea-Bissau.  Secretary of State for Hospital Management Cornelia Aleluia Lopes Man indicated that this batch of equipment includes 2,000 protective masks, 10,000 surgical masks, 2,000 disposable coveralls, 500 infrared thermometers, 2,000 glasses, 1,000 pairs of disposable nitrile gloves and 10,000 pairs of disposable shoe covers.   It was reported reported that the World Food Program (WFP) coordinated the transportation of the materials.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China donates anti-epidemic supplies to Guinea-Bissau in April 2020

# Description
On April 18, 2020, protective and preventative equipment amidst COVID arrived in Guinea-Bissau.  Secretary of State for Hospital Management Cornelia Aleluia Lopes Man indicated that this batch of equipment includes 2,000 protective masks, 10,000 surgical masks, 2,000 disposable coveralls, 500 infrared thermometers, 2,000 glasses, 1,000 pairs of disposable nitrile gloves and 10,000 pairs of disposable shoe covers.   It was reported reported that the World Food Program (WFP) coordinated the transportation of the materials.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of protective equipment and medical supplies for COVID-19 response

title: Sichuan Donates Face Masks and Protective Suits to Guinea-Bissau
description: On December 7, 2020, the Sichuan province donated 8,000 face masks and waterproof protective suits to Guinea-Bissau to aid their fight against COVID-19.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: Chinese Government Provides Donation of Anti-Epidemic Supplies to Guyana Council of Organizations for Persons with Disabilities in May 2020
description: On May 12th, 2020, the Chinese government donated 1.1 million GYD worth of emergency life and epidemic prevention materials to the Guyana Council of Organizations for Persons with Disabilities (GCOPD). The donation consisted of rice, flour, disinfectants, sanitation hampers and other materials to prevent the spread of Covid-19.
combined_text:
# Sector

# Title

# Description
On May 12th, 2020, the Chinese government donated 1.1 million GYD worth of emergency life and epidemic prevention materials to the Guyana Council of Organizations for Persons with Disabilities (GCOPD). The donation consisted of rice, flour, disinfectants, sanitation hampers and other materials to prevent the spread of Covid-19.
justification: Project is focused on social development and public health support without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of emergency life and epidemic prevention materials to support persons with disabilities during COVID-19 pandemic

title: Fuzhou donates 30,000 masks to Guyana in May 2020
description: On May 29th, 2020, Fuzhou donated Covid-19 medical supplies in the form of 30,0000 masks to Georgetown, Guyana. The masks were donated by Fuzhou to greatly enhance the city of Georgetown's ability to deal with the Covid-19 Pandemic.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: Chinese Government provides donation of Covid-19 equipment to Guyana in April 2020
description: On April 27th, 2020, a handover ceremony was held for the donation of Covid-19 medical equipment from China to Guyana (Source ID #105524). The equipment included 500 masks, 500 sets of PPE, 100 thermometers, 500 pairs of medical goggles, 500 pairs of gloves, and 500 shoe covers (Source ID #157526).
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: Chinese Government provides donation of anti-epidemic supplies to Georgetown Public Hospital in June 2020
description: On June 11th, 2020, the Chinese Government provided a donation of protective clothing, goggles, thermometers, and more unlisted items to the Georgetown Public Hospital (Source ID #157158). The donation ceremony was attended by embassy officials as well as a representative of the hospital (Source ID #105521).

title: China donates shipping container scanners worth USD 5 million to Guyana in August 2020
description: On August 14th, 2020, China donated NUCTECH mobile container scanners worth USD 5 million to Guyana. The ceremony was held at Guyana National Industries Corporation. The donation includes a relocatable 1 container/vehicle inspection system, 1 container code recognition system, 1 radioactivity monitor, and 2 x-ray inspection systems.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRADE POLICIES AND REGULATIONS

# Title
China donates shipping container scanners worth USD 5 million to Guyana in August 2020

# Description
On August 14th, 2020, China donated NUCTECH mobile container scanners worth USD 5 million to Guyana. The ceremony was held at Guyana National Industries Corporation. The donation includes a relocatable 1 container/vehicle inspection system, 1 container code recognition system, 1 radioactivity monitor, and 2 x-ray inspection systems.
justification: Project involves donation of security and inspection equipment without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Container scanners, code recognition system, radioactivity monitor, x-ray inspection systems - all related to trade security

title: Chinese Embassy provides donation of anti-epidemic supplies to Guyana in August 2020
description: On August 14th, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Guyana handed over a donation of anti-epidemic materials to Guyana's Ministry of Health. The materials included 350 sets of PPE, 900 goggles, 4 RESmart BPAP machines, and 5520 KN95 masks. The handover ceremony was held at a meeting between the Chinese Ambassador to Guyana and the Minister of Health of Guyana. The supplies are intended to help Guyana fight the COVID-19 pandemic.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Embassy provides donation of anti-epidemic supplies to Guyana in August 2020

# Description
On August 14th, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Guyana handed over a donation of anti-epidemic materials to Guyana's Ministry of Health. The materials included 350 sets of PPE, 900 goggles, 4 RESmart BPAP machines, and 5520 KN95 masks. The handover ceremony was held at a meeting between the Chinese Ambassador to Guyana and the Minister of Health of Guyana. The supplies are intended to help Guyana fight the COVID-19 pandemic.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare support with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of anti-epidemic materials including PPE, goggles, BPAP machines, and masks for COVID-19 response

title: Jiangsu Province provides donation of testing equipment worth GYD 17.2 million to Guyana in October 2020
description: On October 9th, 2020, the Jiangsu Province and Association of Chinese Enterprises in Guyana donated testing equipment worth GYD 17.2 million to Guyana. The testing equipment included a PCR nucleic acid extractor and 10,080 sets of reagents. This testing equipment will greatly shorten the time needed to run COVID-19 tests.
combined_text:

title: Chinese Government deploys 16th medical team to Guyana in October 2020 (Linked to Project ID#90941)
description: On October 1st, 2020, the 16th Chinese Medical Brigade arrived at Georgetown Public Hospital in Guyana. This is a 15-person team and will assist Georgetown Public Hospital for a 1-year tenure. Additionally, on December 22, 2020, this team provided Georgetown Hospital with a donation of medical supplies, which is detailed and captured in Project ID#90941.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title

# Description
On October 1st, 2020, the 16th Chinese Medical Brigade arrived at Georgetown Public Hospital in Guyana. This is a 15-person team and will assist Georgetown Public Hospital for a 1-year tenure. Additionally, on December 22, 2020, this team provided Georgetown Hospital with a donation of medical supplies, which is detailed and captured in Project ID#90941.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare assistance and medical supplies donation without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
